name: Predatory Urge
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has "{T}: This creature deals damage equal to its power to target creature. That creature deals damage equal to its power to this creature."

name: Predict
text: Name a card, then target player puts the top card of his or her library into his or her graveyard. If that card is the named card, you draw two cards. Otherwise, you draw a card.

name: Preeminent Captain
text:
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
Whenever Preeminent Captain attacks, you may put a Soldier creature card from your hand onto the battlefield tapped and attacking.

editions.flavor: "If you need an example to lead others to the front lines, consider the precedent set."

name: Preemptive Strike
text: Counter target creature spell.

name: Preferred Selection
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, look at the top two cards of your library. You may sacrifice Preferred Selection and pay {2}{G}{G}. If you do, put one of those cards into your hand. If you don't, put one of those cards on the bottom of your library.

name: Premature Burial
text: Destroy target nonblack creature that entered the battlefield since your last turn ended.

editions.flavor:
"This soil knows well the taste of the dead. Give it the hunger for a living meal, and it can become a deadly ally."
—Ezrith, druid of the Dark Hours

name: Preordain
text: Scry 2, then draw a card. (To scry 2, look at the top two cards of your library, then put any number of them on the bottom of your library and the rest on top in any order.)

name: Prepare
text: Untap target creature. It gets +2/+2 and gains lifelink until end of turn.

name: Prescient Chimera
text:
Flying
Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell, scry 1. (Look at the top card of your library. You may put that card on the bottom of your library.)

name: Presence of Gond
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has "{T}: Create a 1/1 green Elf Warrior creature token."

editions.flavor: "Here lies Gond, hero of Safehold Taldwen. May he ever guide our quest."
"Here lies Gond, hero of Safehold Taldwen. May he ever guide our quest."

name: Presence of the Master
text: Whenever a player casts an enchantment spell, counter it.

editions.flavor:
Peace to all. Peace be all.
—Great Hall floor inscription

name: Presence of the Wise
text: You gain 2 life for each card in your hand.

editions.flavor: "Humbly I bow. Silently I wait. Deeply I listen."

name: Press for Answers
text:
Tap target creature. It doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.
Investigate. (Create a colorless Clue artifact token with "{2}, Sacrifice this artifact: Draw a card.")

name: Press into Service
text:
Support 2. (Put a +1/+1 counter on each of up to two target creatures.)
Gain control of target creature until end of turn. Untap that creature. It gains haste until end of turn.

name: Press the Advantage
text: Up to two target creatures each get +2/+2 and gain trample until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"Show your enemies as much mercy as they would show you."
—Surrak, the Hunt Caller

name: Pressure Point
text:
Tap target creature.
Draw a card.

editions.flavor: Everything has an off switch.
By studying dragon anatomy, Jeskai monks have learned how to locate clusters of nerves that will incapacitate even the mightiest dragons.

name: Pretender's Claim
text:
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature becomes blocked, tap all lands defending player controls.

editions.flavor: The surest way to lose your holdings is to plead for them in Mercadia City's courts.

name: Preyseizer Dragon
text:
Flying
Devour 2 (As this enters the battlefield, you may sacrifice any number of creatures. This creature enters the battlefield with twice that many +1/+1 counters on it.)
Whenever Preyseizer Dragon attacks, it deals damage to target creature or player equal to the number of +1/+1 counters on Preyseizer Dragon.

name: Prey's Vengeance
text:
Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
Rebound (If you cast this spell from your hand, exile it as it resolves. At the beginning of your next upkeep, you may cast this card from exile without paying its mana cost.)

name: Prey Upon
text: Target creature you control fights target creature you don't control. (Each deals damage equal to its power to the other.)

editions.flavor: It is the nature of the strong to survive.

"You don't find many old werewolf hunters."
—Paulin, trapper of Somberwald

"You don't find many old werewolf hunters."
—Paulin, trapper of Somberwald

"You don't find many old werewolf hunters."
—Paulin, trapper of Somberwald
The Somberwald has become a hunting ground for the Dronepack, the group of werewolves that have succumbed to the flesh-twisting power of Emrakul.

"You don't find many old werewolf hunters."
—Paulin, trapper of Somberwald

name: Price of Glory
text: Whenever a player taps a land for mana, if it's not that player's turn, destroy that land.

editions.flavor:
"True strength lies in action. Let the weak react to me."
—Kamahl, pit fighter

name: Price of Knowledge
text:
Players have no maximum hand size.
At the beginning of each opponent's upkeep, Price of Knowledge deals damage to that player equal to the number of cards in that player's hand.

name: Price of Progress
text: Price of Progress deals damage to each player equal to twice the number of nonbasic lands that player controls.

editions.flavor: Man versus nature is not a fair fight.

editions.set: Premium Deck Series: Fire and Lightning
editions.flavor: Man versus nature is not a fair fight.
Enthusiasm can be tempered in the furnace of the earth.

name: Prickleboar
text: As long as it's your turn, Prickleboar gets +2/+0 and has first strike. (It deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)

editions.flavor: "Canyons in the Phoberos badlands are essentially gates to the Underworld."—Mirinthes, Akroan captain

name: Prickly Boggart
text: Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)

editions.flavor:
"Even without the spines, who would dare to touch it?"
—Desmera, perfect of Wren's Run

name: Pride Guardian
text:
Defender
Whenever Pride Guardian blocks, you gain 3 life.

editions.flavor: "Any hotheaded cub can raise a sword in anger."
"Any hotheaded cub can raise a sword in anger."

name: Pride of Lions
text: You may have Pride of Lions assign its combat damage as though it weren't blocked.

editions.set: Duel Decks: Ajani vs. Nicol Bolas
editions.flavor: There's only one thing worse than a hungry lion—many hungry lions.
There's only one thing worse than a hungry lion—many hungry lions.

name: Pride of the Clouds
text:
Flying
Pride of the Clouds gets +1/+1 for each other creature with flying on the battlefield.
Forecast — {2}{W}{U}, Reveal Pride of the Clouds from your hand: Create a 1/1 white and blue Bird creature token with flying. (Activate this ability only during your upkeep and only once each turn.)

name: Priest of Gix
text: When Priest of Gix enters the battlefield, add {B}{B}{B} to your mana pool.

editions.flavor:
"Gix doesn't want a people to rule but puppets to entertain his madness."
—Xantcha, Phyrexian outcast

editions.set: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. the Coalition
editions.flavor:
"Gix doesn't want a people to rule but puppets to entertain his madness."
—Xantcha, Phyrexian outcast

name: Priest of Iroas
text: {3}{W}, Sacrifice Priest of Iroas: Destroy target enchantment.

editions.flavor: "Even my last breath will be a blow struck for Iroas."

name: Priest of the Blood Rite
text:
When Priest of the Blood Rite enters the battlefield, create a 5/5 black Demon creature token with flying.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you lose 2 life.

editions.flavor: Some will sacrifice everything for but a taste of power.
Some will sacrifice everything for but a taste of power.

editions.set: Duel Decks: Nissa vs. Ob Nixilis
editions.flavor: Some will sacrifice everything for but a taste of power.

name: Priest of Titania
text: {T}: Add {G} to your mana pool for each Elf on the battlefield.

editions.flavor: Titania rewards all those who honor the forest by making them a living part of it.
Titania rewards all who honor the forest by making them a living part of it.
Titania rewards all who honor the forest by making them a living part of it.

name: Priest of Urabrask
text: When Priest of Urabrask enters the battlefield, add {R}{R}{R} to your mana pool.

editions.flavor: Even in New Phyrexia, red mana sparks glimmers of individualism, passion, and freedom.

name: Priest of Yawgmoth
text: {T}, Sacrifice an artifact: Add to your mana pool an amount of {B} equal to the sacrificed artifact's converted mana cost.

name: Priests of Norn
text:
Vigilance
Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)

editions.flavor:
"May our blessings sever the tongues of the forsaken."
—Elesh Norn, Grand Cenobite

name: Primal Bellow
text: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn for each Forest you control.

editions.flavor:
"A might spell can be handy against baloths, giants, kraken, the Roil—or if you lose your bearings in the woods."
—Chadir the Navigator

name: Primal Beyond
text:
As Primal Beyond enters the battlefield, you may reveal an Elemental card from your hand. If you don't, Primal Beyond enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool. Spend this mana only to cast an Elemental spell or activate an ability of an Elemental.

name: Primal Boost
text:
Target creature gets +4/+4 until end of turn.
Cycling {2}{G} ({2}{G}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
When you cycle Primal Boost, you may have target creature get +1/+1 until end of turn.

name: Primal Clay
text: As Primal Clay enters the battlefield, it becomes your choice of a 3/3 artifact creature, a 2/2 artifact creature with flying, or a 1/6 Wall artifact creature with defender in addition to its other types. (A creature with defender can't attack.)

name: Primal Cocoon
text:
Enchant creature
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a +1/+1 counter on enchanted creature.
When enchanted creature attacks or blocks, sacrifice Primal Cocoon.

name: Primal Command
text:
Choose two —
• Target player gains 7 life.
• Put target noncreature permanent on top of its owner's library.
• Target player shuffles his or her graveyard into his or her library.
• Search your library for a creature card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.

name: Primalcrux
text:
Trample
Chroma — Primalcrux's power and toughness are each equal to the number of green mana symbols in the mana costs of permanents you control.

editions.flavor: When nature is backed into a corner, just like its children, it lashes out.

name: Primal Druid
text: When Primal Druid dies, you may search your library for a basic land card, put it onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle your library.

editions.flavor: "The power of the woods is only ever borrowed."

name: Primal Forcemage
text: Whenever another creature enters the battlefield under your control, that creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Their calls unheeded by the withered forests, nature shamans channeled the life force of their brethren.

name: Primal Frenzy
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has trample.

editions.flavor:
"Don't dismiss its anger as mindless fury. I assure you, it has purpose."
—Seton, centaur druid

name: Primal Growth
text:
Kicker—Sacrifice a creature. (You may sacrifice a creature in addition to any other costs as you cast this spell.)
Search your library for a basic land card, put that card onto the battlefield, then shuffle your library. If Primal Growth was kicked, instead search your library for up to two basic land cards, put them onto the battlefield, then shuffle your library.

name: Primal Huntbeast
text: Hexproof (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)

editions.flavor:
"To the unskilled, it appears as blurred patches of distorted light. Few have seen its true form."
—Garruk Wildspeaker

name: Primal Order
text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, Primal Order deals damage to that player equal to the number of nonbasic lands he or she controls.

editions.flavor:
"It's strange, but I can feel it when the land is corrupted. I understand why the Autumn Willow is so protective."
—Daria

"It's strange, but I can feel it when the land is corrupted. I understand why the Autumn Willow is so protective."
—Daria

"My sorrow: to dream of simple times, and wake in mine . . . ."
—Ola DaRiol, "Regrets"

name: Primal Plasma
text: As Primal Plasma enters the battlefield, it becomes your choice of a 3/3 creature, a 2/2 creature with flying, or a 1/6 creature with defender.

editions.flavor: Tocasia brushed the gears and cogs from the table. There, before two wide-eyed brothers, she began a lesson on raw elemental magic.
Tocasia brushed the gears and cogs from the table. There, before two wide-eyed brothers, she began a lesson on raw elemental magic.
Tocasia brushed the gears and cogs from the table. There, before two wide-eyed brothers, she began a lesson on raw elemental magic.
Tocasia brushed the gears and cogs from the table. There, before two wide-eyed brothers, she began a lesson on raw elemental magic.

name: Primal Rage
text: Creatures you control have trample. (If a creature you control would assign enough damage to its blockers to destroy them, you may have it assign the rest of its damage to defending player or planeswalker.)

editions.flavor: "Charge!" A great cry went out, and countless elves and Vec soldiers charged up the mountain. Their fury and passion hid the fact that they were horribly outnumbered.
Ferocity and cunning accounted for half the victory. Gravity accounted for the rest.

name: Primal Surge
text: Exile the top card of your library. If it's a permanent card, you may put it onto the battlefield. If you do, repeat this process.

editions.flavor: With Avacyn's return, the flow of life became a tidal wave.

name: Primal Vigor
text:
If one or more tokens would be created, twice that many of those tokens are created instead.
If one or more +1/+1 counters would be placed on a creature, twice that many +1/+1 counters are placed on that creature instead.

name: Primal Visitation
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +3/+3 and has haste.

editions.flavor: Gruul shamans believe all sentient beings have the soul of savagery inside them, an animal form clawing to escape.

name: Primal Whisperer
text:
Primal Whisperer gets +2/+2 for each face-down creature on the battlefield.
Morph {3}{G} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)

name: Prime Speaker Zegana
text:
Prime Speaker Zegana enters the battlefield with X +1/+1 counters on it, where X is the greatest power among other creatures you control.
When Prime Speaker Zegana enters the battlefield, draw cards equal to its power.

name: Primeval Bounty
text:
Whenever you cast a creature spell, create a 3/3 green Beast creature token.
Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, put three +1/+1 counters on target creature you control.
Whenever a land enters the battlefield under your control, you gain 3 life.

name: Primeval Force
text: When Primeval Force enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you sacrifice three Forests.

editions.flavor: It has germinated in the earth for thousands of years. Finally it wakes to the battle's call.

name: Primeval Light
text: Destroy all enchantments target player controls.

editions.flavor:
"Look to the old tomes, those bound in hides and written in yarberry ink. They hold the spells that can free us of the clutter of modern magecraft."
—Dravash, dowsing shaman

name: Primeval Protector
text:
Primeval Protector costs {1} less to cast for each creature your opponents control.
When Primeval Protector enters the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on each other creature you control.

editions.flavor: The earth shook in support of their cause, offering a champion of its own.

name: Primeval Shambler
text: {B}: Primeval Shambler gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: His mind, like his body, is made up of the swamp's flotsam.
His mind, like his body, is made up of the swamp's flotsam.

name: Primeval Titan
text:
Trample
Whenever Primeval Titan enters the battlefield or attacks, you may search your library for up to two land cards, put them onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle your library.

editions.flavor: When nature calls, run.
When nature calls, run.
When nature calls, run.
When nature calls, run.

name: Primitive Etchings
text: Reveal the first card you draw each turn. Whenever you reveal a creature card this way, draw a card.

editions.flavor: Ancient carvings in the trees of Krosa glow with power once again.

name: Primitive Justice
text:
As an additional cost to cast Primitive Justice, you may pay {1}{R} and/or {1}{G} any number of times.
Destroy target artifact. For each additional {1}{R} you paid, destroy another target artifact. For each additional {1}{G} you paid, destroy another target artifact, and you gain 1 life.

name: Primoc Escapee
text:
Flying
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

editions.flavor: Though a completely artificial species, primocs are a natural fit for the skies of Otaria.

name: Primordial Hydra
text:
Primordial Hydra enters the battlefield with X +1/+1 counters on it.
At the beginning of your upkeep, double the number of +1/+1 counters on Primordial Hydra.
Primordial Hydra has trample as long as it has ten or more +1/+1 counters on it.

name: Primordial Ooze
text:
Primordial Ooze attacks each turn if able.
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a +1/+1 counter on Primordial Ooze. Then you may pay {X}, where X is the number of +1/+1 counters on it. If you don't, tap Primordial Ooze and it deals X damage to you.

editions.flavor: The thick, moving mass from the beginning of evolution swallows and digests the animate and inanimate as it unthinkingly strives to continue its existence.

name: Primordial Sage
text: Whenever you cast a creature spell, you may draw a card.

editions.flavor: For each creature that arrives in its audience, the sage imparts another piece of ancient wisdom for all to hear.
For each creature that arrives in its audience, the sage imparts another piece of ancient wisdom for all to hear.

name: Prince of Thralls
text: Whenever a permanent an opponent controls is put into a graveyard, put that card onto the battlefield under your control unless that opponent pays 3 life.

editions.flavor: "There are none alive that I cannot crush. There are none dead that I do not command."

name: Princess Lucrezia
text: {T}: Add {U} to your mana pool.

name: Prism Array
text:
Converge — Prism Array enters the battlefield with a crystal counter on it for each color of mana spent to cast it.
Remove a crystal counter from Prism Array: Tap target creature.
{W}{U}{B}{R}{G}: Scry 3. (Look at the top three cards of your library, then put any number of them on the bottom of your library and the rest on top in any order.)

name: Prismatic Boon
text: Choose a color. X target creatures gain protection from the chosen color until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"How ironic that the greatest forge of civilization is battle."
—Mangara

name: Prismatic Circle
text:
Cumulative upkeep {1} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
As Prismatic Circle enters the battlefield, choose a color.
{1}: The next time a source of your choice of the chosen color would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

name: Prismatic Geoscope
text:
Prismatic Geoscope enters the battlefield tapped.
Domain — {T}: Add X mana in any combination of colors to your mana pool, where X is the number of basic land types among lands you control.

name: Prismatic Lace
text: Target permanent becomes the color or colors of your choice. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)

name: Prismatic Lens
text:
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
{1}, {T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

editions.flavor: It bends not light but mana, aligning its chaotic currents into the sharp angles necessary for the mystic's purposes.
It bends not light but mana, aligning its chaotic currents into the sharp angles necessary for the mystic's purposes.

name: Prismatic Omen
text: Lands you control are every basic land type in addition to their other types.

editions.flavor: In times of portent, the land sculpts itself in accordance with the sigils burned on the sky.

name: Prismatic Strands
text:
Prevent all damage that sources of the color of your choice would deal this turn.
Flashback—Tap an untapped white creature you control. (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

name: Prismatic Ward
text:
Enchant creature
As Prismatic Ward enters the battlefield, choose a color.
Prevent all damage that would be dealt to enchanted creature by sources of the chosen color.

editions.flavor: "These, of all spells, must have common components I can isolate and use." —Halvor Arenson, Kjeldoran Priest

name: Prismatic Wardrobe
text: Destroy target card that does not share a color with clothing worn by its controller. You cannot choose an artifact or land card.

editions.flavor:
"Spring in Dominaria means pastels!"
—Excerpt from Mage's Home Journal

name: Prism Ring
text:
As Prism Ring enters the battlefield, choose a color.
Whenever you cast a spell of the chosen color, you gain 1 life.

editions.flavor: Wear it on your dominant hand and it will follow your lead.

name: Prismwake Merrow
text:
Flash
When Prismwake Merrow enters the battlefield, target permanent becomes the color or colors of your choice until end of turn.

editions.flavor: "Seeing is believing" is a fact the merrows ruthlessly exploit in their dealings with the other residents of Shadowmoor.

name: Prison Barricade
text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Kicker {1}{W} (You may pay an additional {1}{W} as you cast this spell.)
If Prison Barricade was kicked, it enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it and with "Prison Barricade can attack as though it didn't have defender."

name: Prison Term
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack or block, and its activated abilities can't be activated.
Whenever a creature enters the battlefield under an opponent's control, you may attach Prison Term to that creature.

editions.flavor: Clear out the cell. Bring in the next prisoner.

name: Pristine Angel
text:
Flying
As long as Pristine Angel is untapped, it has protection from artifacts and from all colors.
Whenever you cast a spell, you may untap Pristine Angel.

name: Pristine Skywise
text:
Flying
Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, untap Pristine Skywise. It gains protection from the color of your choice until end of turn.

editions.flavor: The elite of Ojutai's brood, the skywise see their enemies as puzzles to be solved.

text: {T}: Add {C} to your mana pool. You gain 1 life.

text:
Enchant creature
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put a page counter on Private Research.
When enchanted creature dies, draw a card for each page counter on Private Research.

name: Privileged Position
text:
({G/W} can be paid with either {G} or {W}.)
Other permanents you control have hexproof. (They can't be the targets of spells or abilities your opponents control.)

name: Prized Amalgam
text: Whenever a creature enters the battlefield, if it entered from your graveyard or you cast it from your graveyard, return Prized Amalgam from your graveyard to the battlefield tapped at the beginning of the next end step.

editions.flavor:
"Ludevic's laboratory is a veritable wonderland. I have never felt so inspired."
—Stitcher Geralf

name: Prized Elephant
text:
Prized Elephant gets +1/+1 as long as you control a Forest.
{G}: Prized Elephant gains trample until end of turn. (If this creature would assign enough damage to its blockers to destroy them, you may have it assign the rest of its damage to defending player or planeswalker.)

name: Prized Unicorn
text: All creatures able to block Prized Unicorn do so.

editions.flavor:
"The desire for its magic horn inspires such bloodthirsty greed that all who see the unicorn will kill to possess it."
—Dionus, elvish archdruid

The Scrappers, an underground group with a passion for automaton brawls, had renegade leanings even before the Consulate's crackdown. It didn't take long for them to lend their best brawlers to the conflict.

name: Probe
text:
Kicker {1}{B} (You may pay an additional {1}{B} as you cast this spell.)
Draw three cards, then discard two cards.
If Probe was kicked, target player discards two cards.

name: Processor Assault
text:
Devoid (This card has no color.)
As an additional cost to cast Processor Assault, put a card an opponent owns from exile into that player's graveyard.
Processor Assault deals 5 damage to target creature.

editions.flavor: Ulamog's processors trail behind him, converting ruined matter into furious energy.

text:
Return up to three target creature cards with converted mana cost 1 or less from your graveyard to the battlefield.

name: Profane Command
text:
Choose two —
• Target player loses X life. 
• Return target creature card with converted mana cost X or less from your graveyard to the battlefield.
• Target creature gets -X/-X until end of turn.
• Up to X target creatures gain fear until end of turn. (They can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)

editions.set: Duel Decks: Ajani vs. Nicol Bolas

name: Profane Memento
text: Whenever a creature card is put into an opponent's graveyard from anywhere, you gain 1 life.

editions.flavor:
"An angel's skull is left too plain by death. I made a few aesthetic modifications."
—Dommique, blood artist
